settings.heading: Frequently Asked Questions

settings.text: Ameda

settings.heading: What if I'm experiencing issues with my pump?
settings.text: If you experience an issue with your pump, it falls within the warranty time frame, and you are the original owner, please contact our ParentCare team for assistance. In the United States, our Ameda ParentCare™ staff can answer consumer questions about proper use of Ameda® products, replacement parts and more. Give us a call at 1-866-992-6332 / 1-866-99-AMEDA or drop us a line at ParentCare@ameda.com. We are available Monday through Friday 8:00 a.m. – 4:30 p.m. Central Standard Time.

settings.heading: What are Ameda's Shipping Terms?
settings.text:
Ameda ships to all U.S. States and Puerto Rico. We do not ship Internationally.

What shipping & delivery options do you offer?

Due to carrier service challenges across the country, Ameda cannot currently guarantee expedited shipping and delivery dates. Delivery dates are estimations only. Any delivery date estimations are provided exclusively by the shipping carrier and Ameda does not offer any guarantee or warranty as to accuracy.

Please note that all shipping windows are using business days. Business days are defined as Monday – Friday, 8:00am – 2:00pm central time. Orders are not processed, shipped or delivered on weekends or holidays. Some locations outside of the contiguous U.S. require additional transit time.

Shipping Methods

Standard Shipping

$5 for orders under $25

Free on orders $25 and over

Orders arrive within 5 to 7 business days

Expedited Shipping

$18.90 for all orders

Orders placed before 1 p.m. central time Monday thru Friday will ship same day.

Orders placed after 1:30 p.m. central time Monday thru Friday, and weekend and holiday orders will ship the next business day.

Orders arrive within 2 business days.

Overnight Shipping

$30.90 for all orders

Orders placed before 1 p.m. central time Monday thru Friday will ship same day.

Orders placed after 1:30 p.m. central time Monday thru Friday, and weekend and holiday orders will ship the next business day.

Orders arrive within 1 business days.

settings.heading: Can I return or exchange an item?
settings.text:
Ameda offers a no hassle return policy for unopened items. Unopened items must have the original safety seal, that is put on by the factory, intact and untampered with.

All returns and exchanges can only be done if purchased from us directly via our eCommerce website. In order to qualify A return request must be received within 7 days of receiving the item with valid proof of purchase. All items must be unopened.

Please email us at ParentCare@ameda.com to receive return instructions. Include your order ID number, item(s) you would like to return, and reason for return. Once the return is approved we will email you the Return form and address for returning your item(s). “Return” constitutes receipt of the product by our warehouse. If you choose to use an Ameda.com return label, the cost of return will be subtracted from your refund amount.

Items must be in the original, undamaged manufacturer’s packaging with all packaging materials, including instruction booklets, packing inserts, plastic bags, and the warranty cards. The manufacturer’s labeled packaging must be enclosed within a new shipping carton.

Once we receive your return in the proper condition, we will then provide a refund to your payment account usually within 2-4 weeks. Returns cannot be accepted without a return form. Shipping, handling fees, discontinued products and special-order items if applicable, are not refundable.

settings.heading: What payment methods are accepted?
settings.text: We accept American Express™, Discover™, MasterCard™ and Visa™.

settings.heading: Do you have a recycling program?
settings.text: Ameda does not currently offer a recycling program for used pumps. We suggest you contact your local waste management provider to determine if there are options in your area for recycling.

settings.heading: Who should I contact if I have a performance issue with my pump?
settings.text: We recommend that you call our ParentCare Department when you have a few minutes available at 866-992-6332 M-F 8:00am-4:30pm CST for warranty assistance. Due to the nature of our product, we need to conduct our product troubleshooting over the phone. Troubleshooting may include listening to your motor, so please have your pump and pump accessories readily available when calling. General questions can be emailed to parentcare@ameda.com.

settings.heading: What if I have another issue with my pump?
settings.text: Your Finesse breast pump carries a two-year product warranty and all other personal electric breast pumps from Ameda carry a one-year product warranty from the date of receipt and our ParentCare staff is here to assist you during your breast pumping journey. Please call our ParentCare Department at 866-992-6332 M-F 8:00 am-4:30pm CST when you have a few minutes to discuss any issues you are experiencing. We will provide troubleshooting support over the phone to determine if a product related issue exists. If we determine that our product is the root cause of the issue you are experiencing, we will assist you under the terms of the product warranty. If a product related issue is not found, our ParentCare Specialists can support you further by providing additional product education and guidance that may help enhance your overall lactation and pumping experience.

settings.heading: Mya and Mya Joy look similar – what is the main difference between the two pumps?
settings.text: Mya and Mya Joy are both small, lightweight personal use pumps. They both provide hospital strength performance and are designed for moms pumping on a daily basis. Mya includes an internal lithium battery and uses it own unique pump kit and flange system. Mya Joy has a internal battery back-up option that requires 4 AA batteries. Mya Joy is also compatible with most components in the Ameda HygieniKit including containers, tubing and CustomFit flanges.

settings.heading: Are the Mya family of pumps covered by insurance? How can I find out if my insurance plan covers them?
settings.text: The Mya and Mya Joy are covered by most insurance plans. To find out your options contact your insurance plan directly. Ameda also has a convenient web page to learn more and search for a Durable Medical Equipment (DME) provider that covers Ameda pumps.

settings.heading: I received an Ameda HygieniKit™ in the hospital – can I use it with my Mya Joy Pump?
settings.text: The HygieniKit you received in the hospital is mostly compatible with your Mya Joy pumping kit. All CustomFit™ flanges, containers/lids and tubing from your Ameda hospital kit can be used with the Joy. The diaphragm and valve pieces in the Joy are slightly different from those used in your HygieniKit so we recommend that only use the diaphragm and valves that come with your Mya Joy pump (just toss out the old ones). Two new sets of valves and diaphragms come with each Mya Joy pump.

settings.heading: Mya Joy is so small – will it be powerful enough to use when I go back to work?
settings.text: Yes. The Mya Joy pump features hospital strength performance and is designed for daily use by moms. It also features two modes of pumping (stimulation and expression) and a large range of settings for mom’s comfort. Plus - Joy is so small and quiet, mom can take it with her where -ever she needs to go!

settings.heading: Does Mya Joy have a battery option?
settings.text: Yes. The Mya Joy has an internal battery compartment that requires 4 AA batteries.

settings.heading: Where can I buy spare parts for my Mya Joy pump?
settings.text: Mya Joy parts are conveniently available on the Ameda.com website and through many online retail and DME partners nationwide including Amazon.

settings.heading: Does Mya Joy have a battery option?
settings.text: Yes. The Mya has a built-in lithium battery that provides up to two hours of pumping time on a single charge. Mom can conveniently pump without having to worry about being plugged in!

settings.heading: I received an Ameda HygieniKit™ in the hospital – can I use it with my Mya Pump?
settings.text: The Mya pump uses a unique pump kit and flange system. The HygieniKit™ parts and CustomFit™ Flanges are not compatible with the Mya.

settings.heading: Mya is so small – will it be powerful enough to use when I go back to work?
settings.text: Yes. The Mya pump features hospital strength performance and is designed for daily use by moms. It also features two modes of pumping (stimulation and expression) and a large range of settings for mom’s comfort. Plus - Mya is so small and quiet, mom can take it with her where -ever she needs to go!

settings.heading: Where can I buy spare parts for my Mya Pump?
settings.text: Mya parts are conveniently available on the Ameda.com website and through many online retail and DME partners nationwide including Amazon. There are a wide range of spare parts for Mya including 5 unique flange sizes so mom can find her perfect fit!

settings.heading: Flange Fit
settings.text: Proper flange fit is essential to successful breast pumping. Pumping should not cause discomfort. Additionally, using the proper size flange will ensure maximum milk output. A good fit allows your nipple to move freely in the breast flange tunnel. You should see some space around the nipple. Only a little of the areola should be drawn into the tunnel with the nipple. The flange is too small if some or all of your nipple rubs against the sides of the breast flange tunnel. The flange is too big if more areola is drawn into the breast flange with your nipple and/or if your areola rubs against the side of the breast flange tunnel. Refer to your instruction manual for pictures of a good flange fit. You may also call our ParentCare Department at 866-992-6332 to conduct a flange fit over the phone. To see our range of flanges, refer to the below chart:

settings.heading: Are valves covered by the warranty?
settings.text: Your Ameda pump includes 4 valves upon receipt. In most cases, 2 of your valves will be pre-assembled on the breast flange. Check the plastic bag that contains the bottle disk and collar for your 2 spare valves. Valves are a routine maintenance piece part, requiring replacement every 2-3 months, depending on care and frequency of pumping. You can purchase replacements valves at Ameda.com as Ameda does not provide additional valves free of charge and insurance does not cover this piece part. We strongly urge you to purchase Ameda brand valves only, 2 per package. Off brand valves and other accessories are marketed as “compatible with” Ameda pumps. However, off-brand product does not work well with our pump and use of off-brand product will void your Ameda warranty.

settings.heading: What pieces or parts need to be replaced routinely on my Ameda Breast Pump?
settings.text:
Pump Maintenance

WATCH VIDEO

settings.heading: How should I clean/sanitize the piece parts in my HygieniKit?
settings.text:
Before first use, unless otherwise directed by your healthcare provider, prepare your HygieniKit as follows:

  1. Set aside tubing, adapter cap and tubing adapter. These parts do not need to be cleaned.
  2. Take apart the remaining parts (the diaphragms, flanges, valves, storage bottles, locking rings and discs. These are the parts that can touch the breast milk.
  3. Boil a pot of clean water.
  4. Place the diaphragms, flanges, valves, storage boles, locking rings and discs into the pot of boiling water for 20 minutes.
  5. Wash your hands.
  6. Remove the parts carefully with clean tongs.
  7. Let parts AIR dry on a clean surface.

WARNING: DO not leave boiling parts unattended. DO not allow boiling parts to contact boom of pot. This may cause damage to the parts. For more information, please review our cleaning instruction guide.

Clean & Sanitize

WATCH VIDEO

Valves

  1. Exercise extreme care when washing and drying the valves.
  2. Carefully remove the valve from the flange.
  3. First, rinse the valve in cold water. This will assist with removing fat deposits (a natural component of breast milk). Then swish the valve or soak the valve in warm soapy water.
  4. Do not insert your fingers or any other tools into the valve opening.
  5. Next, rinse the valve again in cool water and allow the valve to air dry.
  6. Do not place the valve directly into the water flowing from the faucet. If your water pressure is too strong, this could cause damage to the valve.

WATCH VIDEO

Flanges, Bottles locking Rings & Discs

  1. Hand wash in warm soapy water and allow to air dry
  2. Upper rack of standard, household dishwasher may also be used for flanges and boles
  3. Do not use steam sterilizer bags or steam bole sterilizers

Tubing

The tubing does not require cleaning before first use or in between uses. Our Proven Airlock Protection barrier helps protect milk while keeping pump tubing dry and clean.
